page.title: 17Pipewell Village-General
page.content: Pipewell is a hamlet near Wilbarston. Yet it was once a very important centre for the whole of the Midlands. King John used to hold his Midland Parliament there. Deer can still be seen in the wood where he used to shoot, which was part of Rockingham Castle estate. A Cistercian Abbey was built in 1143 by William De Betevileyn, as a daughter house of Fountains Abbey. Unfortunately this was destroyed by Henry 8th and little evidence, apart from some earth, remains. The plague is supposed to have come to the abbey in 1491 and the monks' bodies were buried in consecrated ground. Their ghosts are supposed to be seen in Skeleton Wood. Pipewell Woods contain the "3 bears house", an old gamekeeper's house, which now contains stuffed animals. The village also contains a trout pond called Harpers
